.

member.name: T:MonoTorrent.Client.Block
member.summary: Represents a block which is the unit of data that the engine downloads
member.remarks: Each object consists of multiple Blocks. Each of these blocks must be requested individually in order to receive the entire piece.

member.summary: The index of the that this block belongs to
member.value: Returns the index of the Piece that this block belongs to

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.Block.Received
member.summary: Indicates if the block has been recieved from a remote peer
member.value: Returns true if the block has been received from a remote peer; otherwise, false

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.Block.Requested
member.summary: Indicates if the block has been requested off a remote peer
member.value: Returns true if the block has been requested off a remote peer; otherwise, false

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.Block.RequestLength
member.summary: The length of the block of data being requested
member.value: Returns the length of the block of data being requested

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.Block.StartOffset
member.summary: The offset which indicates where this block starts within the piece
member.value: The offset which indicates where this block starts within the piece

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.Block.Written
member.summary: Indicates if the block has been written to disk yet
member.value: Returns true if the block has been written to disk yet; otherwise, false

member.name: T:MonoTorrent.Client.ClientEngine
member.summary: Represents the engine used to download torrents
member.remarks: In order to download torrents, an instance of this engine must be instantiated and then instances of must be registered with that engine.

member.name: C:MonoTorrent.Client.ClientEngine.#ctor
member.param: The settings used to construct the engine with

remarks.para: A default SocketListener will be created which listens for incoming connections at the ListenPort specified in the
A default will be created which will read/write pieces from the directory where the files shall be saved to.

block.para: This instance must be disposed when it is no longer in use. Any objects still referenced with the engine are not disposed.

remarks.para: A default will be created which will read/write pieces from the directory where the files shall be saved to.

block.para: This instance must be disposed when it is no longer in use. Any objects still referenced with the engine are not disposed.

block.para: This instance must be disposed when it is no longer in use. Any objects still referenced with the engine are not disposed.

member.summary: Returns true if a with the same is registered with this instance
member.returns: True if a with the same InfoHash is registered with the engine; otherwise, false
member.remarks: Equivalence is determined by comparing the value of the property of the Torrent in the TorrentManager

member.summary: Returns true if a with the same is registered with this instance
member.returns: Returns true if a TorrentManager with the same is registered.

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.Client.ClientEngine.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes internal resources and shuts down any remaining internal processes gracefully.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.ClientEngine.IsRunning
member.summary: Returns true if there are active instances registered with this instance
member.value: True if there are active tranfers; otherwise, false

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.Client.ClientEngine.PauseAll
member.summary: Pauses all registered instances which are active
member.remarks: An active is either one which is in the Downloading or Seeding state.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.ClientEngine.PeerId
member.summary: The unique identifier of the ClientEngine which is sent to other peers.
member.value:
A randomly generated 20 byte string used to uniquely identify a specific instance of a ClientEngine.
At the start of each connection, a is sent. This message contains the value of the PeerId.
member.remarks: This value is randomly generated when the ClientEngine is instantiated

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.Client.ClientEngine.Register(MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentManager)
member.remarks: A must be registered to an engine before it can download. Once registered to an engine, the will obey the global settings defined in the property.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.ClientEngine.Settings
member.summary: The settings used to control various properties of the ClientEngine
member.value: This is the same instance of as was passed into the contructor

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.Client.ClientEngine.StartAll
member.summary: Starts all registered instances which are inactive
member.remarks: An inactive is either one which is in the Paused or Stopped state.

member.name: E:MonoTorrent.Client.ClientEngine.StatsUpdate
member.summary: This event is raised whenever the statistics such as download speed, upload speed etc are updated.

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.Client.ClientEngine.StopAll
member.summary: Stops all registered instances which are either active or currently performing a hashcheck.
member.returns:
A WaitHandle array which can be used to check when the engine has stopped all active instances.
There are several blocking operations which must be performed when stopping a . Once these operations complete, the corresponding WaitHandle will be signalled. When all the WaitHandles have been signalled, all the instances will have been stopped.
member.remarks: An active is either one which is in the Downloading or Seeding state.

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Client.ClientEngine.SupportsDht
member.summary: True if Dht support is enabled; otherwise, false

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Client.ClientEngine.SupportsEncryption
member.summary: True if Encryption support is enabled; otherwise, false
member.remarks: The form of encryption used is simple. It is not meant to be cryptographically secure, only to make it more difficult to detect BitTorrent traffic.

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Client.ClientEngine.SupportsEndgameMode
member.summary: True if the special EndGameMode for piece picking is supported; otherwise, false

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Client.ClientEngine.SupportsExtended
member.summary: True if Libtorrent Extended Messaging support is enabled; otherwise, false
member.remarks: The Libtorrent Extension Protocol allows user defined messages to be implemented in such a way as to easily integrate with the existing protocol for messaging.

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Client.ClientEngine.SupportsFastPeer
member.summary: True if Fast Peer support is enabled; otherwise, false
member.remarks: The Fast Peer extensions enable a number of additional subclasses found in the namespace. These messages enable a peer to download pieces faster in the initial stages of the downloading and allow other optimisations to the downloading and seeding strategies to be performed.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.ClientEngine.TotalDownloadSpeed
member.summary: The combined download speed of all registered instances.
member.value: Returns a value between 0 and which represents the upload speed in bytes per second.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.ClientEngine.TotalUploadSpeed
member.summary: The combined upload speed of all registered instances.
member.value: Returns a value between 0 and which represents the upload speed in bytes per second.

member.name: T:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId
member.summary: Represents an active session with a peer
member.remarks: Whenever a new connection is received, a PeerId is supplied in the event which can be used to reference the connection.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId.AmChoking
member.summary: Indicates if the remote peer is choked
member.value: True if the peer is being choked; otherwise, false

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId.AmInterested
member.summary: Indicates if the remote peer is interesting
member.value: True if the peer has pieces that are not available locally; otherwise, false

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId.AmRequestingPiecesCount
member.summary: Indicates the number of concurrent requests on the peer
member.value:
Returns the number of active block requests made on the peer.
Each is downloaded in sections. Each section is represented by a . This method returns the number of s which have been requested and not yet received.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId.Bitfield
member.summary: Indicates the pieces which the peer claims it has downloaded
member.value: Returns a bitfield which indicates what pieces the peer claims to have

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId.ClientSoftware
member.summary: Returns a instance which indicates the application the peer is using to download with.
member.value: Returns a instance which indicates the application the peer is using to download with.

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId.CloseConnection
member.summary: Queues the connection to be closed.
member.remarks: Once this method is called, the connection will be queued to be closed and the internal resources released.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId.Encryptor
member.summary: The used to encrypt the connection
member.value: The used to encrypt the connection

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId.HashFails
member.summary: The number of times a complete piece has been downloaded which failed the hash check
member.value: The number of times a complete piece has been downloaded which failed the hash check

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId.IsChoking
member.summary: Indicates if the remote peer is choking
member.value: Returns true if the peer is currently choking this connection; otherwise, false
member.remarks: Every new connection starts off being choked and uninterested. If the peer advertises a piece that has not yet been downloaded, an 'Interested' message is sent to the remote peer. When the remote peer sends an 'Unchoke' message, the piece can be requested.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId.IsInterested
member.summary: Indicates if the remote peer is interested
member.value: Returns true if the remote peer is interested; otherwise, false

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId.IsRequestingPiecesCount
member.summary: The number of concurrent blocks the remote peer is requesting
member.value: The number of concurrent blocks the remote peer is requesting

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId.IsSeeder
member.summary: Indicates if the remote peer is sharing the entire file
member.value: Returns true if the remote peer is sharing the entire file; otherwise, false

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId.IsValid
member.summary: Indicates if the connection is still active
member.value: Returns true if the connection to the remote peer is still active; otherwise false
member.remarks: While this value returns true, the PeerId will be updated with fresh data. Once the connection disconnects, IsValid will be set to false and will no longer be updated with fresh data. When this happens, all references to this PeerId should be dropped.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId.Location
member.summary: The Uri which the remote peer can be connected to at

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId.Monitor
member.summary: Contains the statistics such as the amount of data downloaded/uploaded this session along with current download/upload speeds.
member.value: Contains the statistics such as the amount of data downloaded/uploaded this session along with current download/upload speeds.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId.Name
member.summary: The Name of the enclosed Torrent
member.value: Returns the 'Name' of the enclosed Torrent

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId.PiecesSent
member.summary: The total number of blocks which have been uploaded to remote peers
member.value: Returns the total number of blocks which have been uploaded to remote peers

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId.SendQueueLength
member.summary: The number of messages which are queued to send to the peer
member.value: Returns the number of messages which are queued to send to the peer

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId.SupportsFastPeer
member.summary: Indicates if the remote peer supports the Fast Peer extension protocol
member.value: Returns true if the remote peer supports the Fast Peer extension protocol; otherwise, false

member.summary: The TorrentManager this peer is associated with
member.value: The TorrentManager this peer is associated with
member.remarks: This property can be used to link a PeerId with a specific TorrentManager

member.name: T:MonoTorrent.Client.Piece
member.summary: Represents a Piece which has an assoicated SHA-1 hash which verifies its integrity
member.remarks: When a torrent is created, it is split into a number of pieces. For each piece, a SHA1 hash is created which can be used to verify if that piece has not been corrupted. Each of these pieces is represented by an instance of this class.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.Piece.AllBlocksReceived
member.summary: Indicates if all the blocks have been received
member.value: Returns true if all the blocks have been received; otherwise, false

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.Piece.AllBlocksRequested
member.summary: Indicates if all the blocks have been reqested
member.value: Returns true if all the blocks have been requested; otherwise, false

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.Piece.AllBlocksWritten
member.summary: Indicates if all the blocks have been written to disk
member.value: Returns true if all the blocks have been written to disk; otherwise, false

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.Piece.BlockCount
member.summary: The number of blocks this piece is divided into
member.value: Returns the number of blocks this piece is divided into

member.value: Returns the index of the piece

member.summary: Gets the block at the specified index
member.value: Returns the block at the specified index

member.summary: Indicates if no blocks have been requested
member.value: Returns true if no blocks have been requested

member.summary: The total number of blocks which have been received
member.value: Returns the total number of blocks which have been received

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.Piece.TotalRequested
member.summary: The total number of blocks which have been requested
member.value: Returns the total number of blocks which have been requested

member.summary: The total number of blocks which have been written to disk

member.summary: Indicates if the download has been finished
member.value: True if the torrent has finished downloading; otherwise, false

member.summary: Cleans up the internal resources and ensures internal processes are stopped

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentManager.HashCheck(System.Boolean)
member.param: If true, existing Fast Resume data will be ignored and a full scan of the files on the hard drive will be performed; otherwise fast resume data will be loaded if available.
member.summary: Performs a hash check on any existing data

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentManager.HashChecked
member.summary: Indicates if a hashcheck has been performed
member.value: True if a hashcheck has been performed using either the Fast Resume data or by hashing the on-disk data; otherwise, false

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentManager.HashFails
member.summary: Indicates the number of pieces which have been received and failed the hash check.
member.value: The number of pieces which have been downloaded and subsequently failed the hash check.

remarks.para:
You can compute the number of bytes wasted due to failing the hashcheck as follows:
int bytesWasted = HashFails * this.Torrent.PieceLength;

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentManager.Monitor
member.summary: Contains the statistics such as the amount of data downloaded/uploaded this session along with current download/upload speeds.
member.value: Contains the statistics such as the amount of data downloaded/uploaded this session along with current download/upload speeds.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentManager.OpenConnections
member.remarks: This includes both connections to other seeders and connections to other leeches

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentManager.Pause
member.summary: Suspends all data transfer but leaves all connections open

member.name: E:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentManager.PeerConnected
member.summary: Raised whenever a new connection is created
member.remarks: This will be raised when either an incoming connection is received or an outgoing connection is created. In both cases, the connection will be fully established before this event is raised.

member.name: E:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentManager.PeerDisconnected
member.summary: Raised whenever an open connection is closed

member.name: E:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentManager.PeersFound
member.summary: Raised whenever new peer details are added to the list of available peers. These are usually supplied as part of an Announce request to a .
member.remarks: If an announce request is sent to a , the returns a list of ip addresses and ports which represent other peers which can be connected to. This event is raised when new and unique peers are found.

member.name: E:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentManager.PieceHashed
member.summary: Raised whenever a piece is hashed
member.remarks: This event will be raised when a piece is hashed as part of the method or when a piece is downloaded from other peers.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentManager.Progress
member.summary: The current progress of the download
member.value: Returns a value between 0 and 100 (inclusive) which represents the percentage of the total data which has been downloaded

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentManager.SavePath
member.summary: The path which was specified in the constuctor where the files will be downloaded to

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentManager.Settings
member.summary: The settings used to control various properties of the TorrentManager
member.value: This is the same instance of as was passed into the contructor

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentManager.StartTime
member.summary: The time that was called at
member.value: Returns the time at which the method was called at.

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentManager.Stop
member.summary:
Stops all data transfer and closes all open connections.
Several blocking operations must be performed to completely shut down a TorrentManager. When these operations have completed, the WaitHandle returned by this method will be signalled. You should not dispose of this instance until the handle has been signalled.
member.returns: A waithandle which will be signalled when the TorrentManager has stopped.

member.name: E:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentManager.TorrentStateChanged
member.remarks: Whenever the TorrentManager changes state, this event is raised.

member.summary: The which deals with all tracker communications
member.value: Returns the which deals with all tracker communications

member.value: Returns the number of peers which are currently being uploaded to

member.name: T:MonoTorrent.Tracker.InfoHashTrackable

member.remarks: This is the default implementation of the ITrackable interface

member.name: C:MonoTorrent.Tracker.InfoHashTrackable.#ctor
member.param: The torrent to create the Trackable for
member.remarks: The torrents 'InfoHash' property and 'Name' property will be stored

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Tracker.InfoHashTrackable.InfoHash
member.summary: Represents the unique identifier for this item
member.value: The unique identifier, typically a 20 byte value
member.remarks: The InfoHash is what is used to compare two ITrackables. These must be unique. Typically, the infohash of a Torrent , a 20 byte value, is used.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Tracker.InfoHashTrackable.Name
member.value: Returns the name of this item
member.remarks: This can be used as a human-readable name for this Trackable

member.name: T:MonoTorrent.Tracker.ITrackable
member.summary: Represents an item, typically the InfoHash of a Torrent, which will be monitored by the tracker

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Tracker.ITrackable.InfoHash
member.summary: Represents the unique identifier for this item
member.value: The unique identifier, typically a 20 byte value

remarks.para: The InfoHash is what is used to compare two ITrackables. These must be unique. Typically, the infohash of a Torrent , a 20 byte value, is used.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Tracker.ITrackable.Name
member.value: Returns the name of this item
member.remarks: This can be used as a human-readable name for this Trackable

member.name: T:MonoTorrent.Tracker.Tracker
member.summary: Represents a Tracker used to handle Announce and Scrape requests
member.remarks: Each Tracker instance can host multiple torrents. Multiple tracker instances can be hosted on the same physical computer, or multiple computers can be used to host Tracker instances as part of a cluster

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.Tracker.Tracker.Add(MonoTorrent.Tracker.ITrackable)
member.param: The to add to the current instance
member.summary: Adds the to the current instance
member.returns: True if the ITrackable was added; false if the ITrackable was already in the instance

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Tracker.Tracker.AllowNonCompact
member.summary: Indicates if the tracker should allow non-compact responses
member.value: True if non-compact responses are supported; otherwise, false
member.remarks: Non-compact responses need significantly more bandwidth than compact responses. Legacy torrent clients may only support non-compact responses.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Tracker.Tracker.AllowScrape
member.summary: Indicates if scrape requests should be allowed
member.value: Returns true if scrape requests are allowed; otherwise, false
member.remarks: A client can issue a 'Scrape' request to get statistics for a specific torrent.

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.Tracker.Tracker.Contains(MonoTorrent.Tracker.ITrackable)
member.param: The to check exists in the current instance
member.summary: Determines whether the specified is contained in the current instance
member.returns: Returns true if the ITrackable is contained in this instance; otherwise, false
member.remarks: Equality is determined by doing an elementwise comparison of the property

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Tracker.Tracker.Count
member.summary: The number of torrents currently being monitored by the Tracker
member.value: Returns the number of torrents currently being monitored by the Tracker

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.Tracker.Tracker.GetEnumerator
